column1: MEN is a Primitive Quendian Sundocarme signifying "go"
column4: proceed (in a direction intended by a person)"
column6: p. 6 (root appearing as "√men") or "have as object

column1: In his notes on a poem in The Road Goes Ever On (book)
column2: J.R.R. Tolkien gave the form men ("direction
column3: region"). It was from this men + el which was invented the Quenya word Menel.
column4: p. 72 It is not known with certainty if men here refers to a Primitive Quendian word (cf. Men (Elvish)#Elvish) or to a root.

column1: *See also: Quenya mene ("goes")Editor Patrick H. Wynne links mene ("goes") to the root MEN ("go"). Cf.
In the The Etymologies appears the root MEN-
